sectionNotes: Restricted to students with Senior class standing. Restricted to Undergrad - Urbana-Champaign.
sectionText: Senior priority enrollment begins November 2nd. Junior priority enrollment begins November 9th.Open enrollment begins at 10am on November 21st.  This course examines the psychological causes and social consequences of stereotyping, prejudice, and discrimination. It also explores methods for reducing prejudice and discrimination in society. Topics include stereotyping, cognitive biases, group conflict, ideology, implicit associations, subtle and benevolent forms of prejudice, and microaggressions. *Approved for General and Social/Personality Psychology Concentration**
